contentrichtext.text: {{about|the mythological figures|other uses|Eurynome (disambiguation)}} '''Eurynomê''' ({{lang|grc|Εὐρυνόμη}}, from {{lang|grc|εὐρύς}}, ''eurys'', "broad" + {{lang|grc|νομός}}, ''nomos'', "pasture" or {{lang|grc|νόμος}} "law") is a name that refers to the following characters in [[Greek mythology]]: #[[Eurynome (Oceanid)]], a divine figure of the pre-Olympian generation #[[Eurynome (daughter of Nisus)|Eurynome]] or Eurymede, daughter of King [[Nisos|Nisus]] of [[Megara]] and mother of [[Bellerophon]] by [[Poseidon]] or [[Glaucus (son of Sisyphus)|Glaucus]].<ref>[[Hesiod]], ''[[Catalogue of Women]]'' fr. 43(a)70–82 M–W, where her name is restored by conjecture based upon [[Gaius Julius Hyginus|Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'' [http://www.theoi.com/Text/HyginusFabulae4.html#157 157]. The manuscripts of the ''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' [http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Apollod.+1.9.3&fromdoc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.01.0022 1.9.3] give her name as Eurymede and names her mortal husband [[Glaucus (son of Sisyphus)|Glaucus]] as Bellerophon's father.</ref> #Eurynome, mother by the Persian [[Orchamus]] of [[Leucothea|Leucothoe]] whom [[Helios]] loved.<ref>[[Ovid]], ''[[Metamorphoses]]'' 4. 208ff</ref> #Eurynome or Cleophyle, wife of [[Lycurgus of Arcadia]] and mother of [[Amphidamas]], [[Epochus]], [[Ancaeus]], and [[Iasus]].<ref>''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 3.9.2.</ref> Elswhere is also called [[Antinoe]].<ref>[[Scholia]] on [[Apollonius Rhodius]], ''Argonautica'', 1. 164.</ref> #Eurynome, daughter of [[Iphitus]] and mother of [[Adrastus]] of Argos by [[Talaus]].<ref>[[Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 70</ref> #Eurynome, waiting woman of [[Penelope]] in the ''[[Odyssey]]''.<ref>[[Homer]], ''Odyssey'', 17. 495</ref> #Eurynome, a handmaiden of [[Harmonia (mythology)|Harmonia]].<ref>[[Nonnus]], ''[[Dionysiaca]]'', 41. 312</ref> #Eurynome, a [[Lemnos|Lemnian]] woman. The goddess [[Pheme]] paid a visit to her in the guise of her friend Neaera to inform her that Eurynome's husband Codrus was being unfaithful to her with a [[Thracia]]n woman.<ref>[[Gaius Valerius Flaccus|Valerius Flaccus]], ''Argonautica'', 2. 136 ff</ref> #Eurynome, an alternate name for Eidothea, the daughter of [[Proteus]].<ref>[[Zenodotus]] in [[scholia]] on ''Odyssey'', 4. 366</ref> #Eurynome, a daughter of [[Asopus]] and mother of Ogygias by [[Zeus]], according to a late source.<ref>[[Clement of Alexandria]], ''Recognitiones'', 10. 21</ref> ==See also== *[[Eurynomos]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Greek mythology]] [[Category:Women in Greek mythology]] [[Category:Characters in the Odyssey]] [[Category:Mortal parents of demigods in Classical mythology]] [[pt:Eurínome]]
